Posts.Content: Try tykerb.  Contact MD Anderson or her own doctor to get her started right away!
Posts.Title: Need help QUICK!!!!

Posts.Content: Thank God someone is asking the same questions my family is asking.  My Mother was diagnosed almost 3 years ago with IBC.  I am educated and so are my three sisters.  We take pride in knowing about and practicing preventative measures for our health.  I had never heard of IBC until my Mother's diagnosis.  I was unaware that breast cancer could be skin changes only and that no mammogram in the world could detect it.  I would be grateful to talk to you via email anytime! JENNIFER SMITH
Posts.Title: Women living with Inflammatory Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Please get checked right away.  My mother has IBC and had no lumps.  She only had a slightly pink area on her right breast.  Contact MD Anderson in Houston and go to their IBC clinic.  It might be nothing, but don't let any doctor tell you not to worry about it.  Make sure they check you for IBC.  Prayers for clean bill of health.
Posts.Title: red spots on the breast

Posts.Content: My mother began taking tykerb about two weeks ago along with Xeloda.  She has stage IV inflammatory breast cancer and it was really her only treatment option.  She had extensive swelling in her right arm due to lymph node involvement and was miserable.  After a week on the tykerb and Xeloda, her swelling decreased enough for the doctor to say the it looked like it was working.  She has been nauseated and tired but she is able to function.  God bless you in your treatment.
Posts.Title: Tykerb

Posts.Content: What does PN2A mean?  My mother has IBC.  Chemo, mastectomy with 39 lymph nodes removed (9 positive), chemo again, radiation, and herceptin.  Reoccurred exaclty two years after intial diagnosis after being declared "cancer free" for three months.  Mets to lungs and lymph nodes.  What is prognosis?  Began Tykerb and Xeloda three days ago.
Posts.Title: IBC Stage IV PN2A
Beware of Misdiagnosis and Seek Second Opinions

Posts.Content: My mother has now been on the tykerb/xeloda for about two months for stage IV IBC with spread to lungs and lymph nodes.  She has had a significant improvement.  Her doctor told her today that her cancer has shrunk remarkebly.  Praise Jesus for miracles and God bless you in your battle!
Posts.Title: Tykerb

Posts.Content: On 5/1/2007 Hana24 wrote: My mom was just put on it last wk.  Its a new med that was just approved by the FDA for metastatic breast cancer pt's. Just wondered if anyone has any info about this new med? My mother was put on tykerb two months ago along with xeloda.  The doctor said it was her only hope.  She has IBC stage IV with spread to lungs and lymph nodes.  After two months of treatment, her doctor said "her cancer has shrunk remarkebly".  I urge you to talk to your doctor and start it as soon as possible.  Check to see which types of breast cancer respond the best to tykerb.  I am not sure if it works for all types of BC.
Posts.Title: Anyone taking new med called tykerb?
